title: Sword And Shield Of Seiros
opening: The Alliance has requested aid from the monastery, but the Knights of Seiros are low on personnel. Alois and Shamir decide that the students will have to suffice...

intro.speaker: Shamir
intro.line: ...And that is our situation.

intro.speaker: Alois
intro.line: But with so few knights, we'll surely--

intro.speaker: Alois
intro.line: Ah, Professor! Excellent timing.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: What's going on?

intro.speaker: Shamir
intro.line: Alois. You're not going to suggest we send students, are you?

intro.speaker: Alois
intro.line: I am, actually. Do you have a problem with that?

intro.speaker: Shamir
intro.line: I do. We can't send them out on a knight's mission without Rhea's blessing.

intro.speaker: Alois
intro.line: I'm sure I can get the go-ahead. I'll just say the students have a...new field training opportunity, or something like that. Besides, we'll be there. We're not going to let them get killed by pirates.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: What's this about pirates?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: What are you talking about?

intro.speaker: Shamir
intro.line: There are pirates causing havoc in the port of Derdriu, at the center of House Riegan's territory.

intro.speaker: Alois
intro.line: The Merchants' Association sent a request via the Eastern Church, asking for protection.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: The Eastern Church?

intro.speaker: Shamir
intro.line: You haven't heard of the Eastern Church? I suppose that's because they don't have much of a presence.

intro.speaker: Alois
intro.line: The Eastern Church controls eastern Fódlan. They don't have a standing army like we do. So, for incidents like this, they customarily ask for help from the Central Church.

intro.speaker: Shamir
intro.line: I imagine they want to contribute to make their presence known in the Alliance.

intro.speaker: Alois
intro.line: Be that as it may, we knights are quite busy. We don't have personnel to spare. Therefore, we're enlisting your help!

intro.speaker: Shamir
intro.line: You should have some experience dealing with pirates from your mercenary days, right?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I may.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I don't remember.

intro.speaker: Shamir
intro.line: The students have dealt with pirates, so this shouldn't be a problem for them.

intro.speaker: Alois
intro.line: Come with us, won't you? Think of it as a training exercise. The Merchants' Association will reward us handsomely!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Let's go.

intro.speaker: Shamir
intro.line: We don't have time to lose. Let's take care of this quickly.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I don't know if I should.

intro.speaker: Alois
intro.line: We're not leaving right away. Think on it.

intro.speaker: Shamir
intro.line: If you wish to join us, let me know.

battle.speaker: Pirate Captain
battle.line: Tremble before us! We are the great navy of Almyra! Resist and we'll burn this town to the ground!

battle.speaker: Alois
battle.line: The Almyran Navy... This is going to be tougher than I expected.

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Huh? Sure, those look like Almyran ships, but I guarantee you they're just common pirates.

battle.speaker: Shamir
battle.line: They're obviously bluffing, but it seems to be working on the merchants. Shall we?

battle.speaker: Merchant
battle.line: It's the knights! Please, save us! We'll reward you handsomely!

battle.speaker: Merchant
battle.line: It would be a disaster if they attacked our shops. Please, don't let them into town!

battle.speaker: Alois
battle.line: We've got you. Leave it to the Knights of Seiros!

battle.speaker: Pirate
battle.line: Hahaha! Smash up the houses and trash the shops! Swipe anything that's not nailed down!

battle.speaker: Merchant
battle.line: Aah! If they attack the town, we won't even be able to pay the knights their reward...

battle.speaker: Alois
battle.line: That's not good. The pirates have got into town. We have to beat them, quick.

battle.speaker: Shamir
battle.line: The town is under attack. We have to move quickly.

battle.speaker: Merchant
battle.line: If the town gets damaged any further, we won't have much to offer as a reward...

battle.speaker: Alois
battle.line: Who cares about the reward? We're trying to protect the people!

battle.speaker: Pirate
battle.line: We are the ruthless barbarians of Almyra! Resist and pay the price!

battle.speaker: Merchant
battle.line: Oh dear... My wares! I'll be ruined! Please, do something quickly!

battle.speaker: Alois
battle.line: We are the Knights of Seiros, and we will not tolerate your violent villainy!

boss.speaker: Claude
boss.line: How could you commit such crimes in the name of Almyra? It's because of two-bit miscreants like you that Almyrans suffer so much hate!

boss.speaker: Pirate Captain
boss.line: Sh-shut up! Say what you will, we're the real navy of Almyra!

boss.speaker: Alois
boss.line: You're in charge of this sorry band, huh? We'll punish you in the name of the goddess!

boss.speaker: Pirate Captain
boss.line: Quiet, you! Time for a counter attack!

boss.speaker: Shamir
boss.line: Hate us all you want. We're just doing our job.

boss.speaker: Pirate Captain
boss.line: Idle prattle! You think you can beat us?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Ugh, what a pain that guy was. If you're going to pose as an Almyran, at least fight like one!

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: Well, that's over with. They were a lot more trouble than I expected.

end.speaker: Merchant
end.line: Thank you so much! Here's your reward. Please, take it.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: Well, we got rid of them, but the town's not looking too pretty.

end.speaker: Merchant
end.line: Thank you. It's not much, but please take this as a reward.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: Good gracious, I didn't expect it to become such a large-scale battle.

end.speaker: Shamir
end.line: It seems they caused the merchants unnecessary confusion by disguising themselves as Almyrans.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: We taught the pirates a lesson though. That should calm them down a bit. I know this was more than you signed up for, but you really saved us!

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: It was an interesting experience.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: It was good training.

end.speaker: Shamir
end.line: Thanks for your help. This can't be how you were expecting your day to go.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: Patient and understanding, just like Captain Jeralt. We owe you a token of our appreciation, I think. Take the reward from the Merchants' Association. Share it with your students, if you like.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Really?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I can't accept this.

end.speaker: Shamir
end.line: Take it. We'll collect our reward from the Eastern Church. Besides, Alois could never keep it for himself.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: Of course not! We knights serve as the sword and shield of Saint Seiros herself. We pride ourselves on our integrity! We reject all rewards that are not perfectly legitimate!

end.speaker: Shamir
end.line: In other words, he's a coward who would feel guilty and lose sleep over it.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: Hmph.

end.speaker: Shamir
end.line: That's also one of his many merits.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: Shamir, you don't mince words. Though it does seem like you've learned how to show a little respect.

end.speaker: Shamir
end.line: Must've learned that from you.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: I don't remember teaching you that. Anyway, Professor, keep the compensation. I'd say you've earned it. Those merchants really needed your help. For all the buying and selling they do, they're not so good at trading blows!

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: Get it, trading blows? They... And merchants, they... Oh, forget it.

end.speaker: Shamir
end.line: We have to prepare for our next mission. Until next time, Professor.
